title: AB 502
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 1925 of the Business and Professions Code is amended. A registered dental hygienist in alternative practice may work in various settings including as an employee, independent contractor, or sole proprietor of an alternative dental hygiene practice. The county's role under Section 17000 of the Welfare and Institutions Code or as an employee of a professional corporation under the Moscone-Knox Professional Corporation Act. Article 9.1 is added to the Business and Professions Code, allowing Registered Dental Hygienists to practice in Alternative Practice Corporations. Registered Dental Hygienists in Alternative Practice Corporations are professional corporations authorized to provide services in compliance with the Moscone-Knox Professional Corporation Act. The Dental Hygiene Committee of California oversees these corporations. It is considered unprofessional conduct for licensed individuals to violate any provisions of the article or related laws. Licensees in dental hygienist alternative practice corporations must practice within their scope of license and comply with licensure provisions. In alternative practice corporations, income from professional services rendered by a dental hygienist while a shareholder cannot benefit the shareholder or their shares. In alternative practice corporations, a registered dental hygienist's bylaws must include provisions for selling capital stock owned by disqualified or deceased persons. Adequate security for patient claims must be provided. Amendments to the Corporations Code clarify definitions. Section 13401 of the Corporations Code is amended to define "professional services" as services requiring a valid license or certification under specific acts. A professional corporation is a corporation engaged in providing professional services in a single profession, with a certificate of registration from the regulating agency. The corporation must designate itself as a professional entity as required by law. Professional corporations providing services regulated by specific boards in California do not need a certificate of registration to offer their services. A "foreign professional corporation" is a corporation from another state engaged in a profession authorized by the Business and Professions Code. A "licensed person" is an individual licensed to provide professional services like those offered by a professional or foreign professional corporation. A "disqualified person" is a licensed individual who becomes legally unable to provide professional services for the corporation they are associated with. Licensed individuals can hold shares in designated professional corporations as long as their total ownership does not exceed 49 percent and the number of shareholders does not exceed the number of licensed persons regulated by the governing agency. This does not restrict employment to only licensed professionals listed under each subdivision. Licensed individuals regulated by the governing agency can be employed by a professional corporation under specific acts. The curr_chunk lists licensed healthcare professionals who can be employed by different types of professional corporations, including medical, podiatric, and psychological corporations. The curr_chunk lists licensed healthcare professionals eligible for employment in various professional corporations, including medical, podiatric, and psychological corporations. The curr_chunk lists licensed healthcare professionals eligible for employment in various professional corporations, including medical, podiatric, and psychological corporations. The professionals include chiropractors, acupuncturists, naturopathic doctors, licensed professional clinical counselors, licensed physicians and surgeons, psychologists, marriage and family therapists, registered nurses, physician assistants, doctors of podiatric medicine, and optometrists. The curr_chunk lists licensed healthcare professionals eligible for employment in various professional corporations, including medical, podiatric, and psychological corporations. The professionals include chiropractors, acupuncturists, naturopathic doctors, licensed professional clinical counselors, licensed physicians and surgeons, psychologists, marriage and family therapists, registered nurses, physician assistants, doctors of podiatric medicine, and optometrists. The professionals listed are licensed doctors of podiatric medicine, psychologists, registered nurses, optometrists, marriage and family therapists, clinical social workers, acupuncturists, naturopathic doctors, licensed professional clinical counselors, physician assistants, chiropractors, and physical therapists. The curr_chunk lists licensed healthcare professionals eligible for employment in various professional corporations, including chiropractors, acupuncturists, physical therapists, doctors of podiatric medicine, marriage and family therapists, clinical social workers, optometrists, professional clinical counselors, dental assistants, dental hygienists, psychologists, registered nurses, and naturopathic doctors. The curr_chunk lists licensed healthcare professionals eligible for employment in professional corporations, including naturopathic doctors, physical therapy corporation, licensed physicians, doctors of podiatric medicine, acupuncturists, occupational therapists, speech-language therapists, audiologists, registered nurses, psychologists, physician assistants, dental hygienists, dental assistants, dentists, and dental hygienists in extended functions.
